profiledesc.creation: Generated by Access to Memory (AtoM) 2.6.4 2023-03-01 14:31 UTC

did.physloc: Archives Cold Storage, Aisle 8, Shelf C

note.p: Israel "Irving" Steinberg was born January 16 1919 in Peterborough Ontario. Shortly after his birth he moved with his parents, Joseph and Leah Steinberg and his sister Rose Steinberg, to Sudbury Ontario where his father founded Toronto Bargain Stores. The Steinbergs lived in Sudbury until 1932 when they moved to Toronto. Joseph Steinberg died on July 14 1963, and Irving Steinberg as executor of his estate retained property in Sudbury until 1968 when it was expropriated by the city as part of a downtown urban development project. Irving Steinberg passed away on March 1, 2011.

scopecontent.p: Colour slides depicting various sights in and around Sudbury in the late 1950s and early 1960s. Some of the slides are numbered suggesting they were part of a larger slideshow on Sudbury. Slides may have been collected to support claims related to the city expropriation of properties on Borgia Street in the 1960s. Slides were produced by various studios in Ontario.

custodhist.p: Earl Levi recieved the slides as power of trustee for Irving Steinberg. He gave the slides to Charles Levi who donated them to the archives.

relatedmaterial.p: Steinberg sous-fonds, Levi/Smith/Weinstock/Steinberg papers in possession of Charles Levi, 2009.

did.physloc: Archives Cold Storage, Aisle 8, Shelf C

scopecontent.p: Item is a picture of a high school taken from the schoolyard.

did.physloc: Archives Cold Storage, Aisle 8, Shelf C

note.p: According to the Leeds 1000 Islands Municipal Heritage Committee, Rideau Air Photos Ltd, based in Seeley Bay, Ontario, operated from about 1957 to about 1961 under partners D.G. Willis and Jack Wyatt.

scopecontent.p: Item is a picture of an office building with "Woolworths" "Crown Life", and "Confederation Life" signs visible. People, the crossing street, and cars also can be seen in the image.

altformavail.p: Item has been digitized. Prints of image may be requested. Email archives@greatersudbury.ca for more information.

scopecontent.p: Item is a picture of a city street, cars, and two children jay-walking. A "Hotel Coulson" sign is clearly visible.

did.physloc: Archives Cold Storage, Aisle 8, Shelf C
did.unittitle: 6. Lisgar St. Looking North Sudbury, Ontario - Robert Brown Ltd - Duplicate Benjamin Film Labs.

note.p: Gordon Brown, Robert Brown's son used to take professional photographs of Sudbury and sell them at Robert Brown Jewelers. Image used with permission of Robert Brown Jewelers.

scopecontent.p: Item is a picture of a city street, cars, and buildings.

altformavail.p: Item has been digitized. Prints of image may be requested. Email archives@greatersudbury.ca for more information.

did.physloc: Archives Cold Storage, Aisle 8, Shelf C
did.unittitle: 38. Four Schools, Public Library and Part of St. Joseph Hospital, Sudbury - Photo Copyright Rideau Air-Photos Ltd Seeley's Bay, Ont. Can

note.p: According to the Leeds 1000 Islands Municipal Heritage Committee, Rideau Air Photos Ltd, based in Seeley Bay, Ontario, operated from about 1957 to about 1961 under partners D.G. Willis and Jack Wyatt.

scopecontent.p: Item is picture of buildings including the Sudbury Public Library and four schools taken from behind a fence, cars, and a roadsign advertising "Carpark" with rates. The schools shown on the hill from left to right are College Notre Dame at s s Levis, Mary Mount High School at 165 D'Youville Street, and St. Elizabeth School Of Nursing (nine floor building) at 30 Ste-Anne Road. On the left side of the library is St Aloysius at 164 Mackenzie Street and the Sudbury High School is accross the street at 154 College Street.

altformavail.p: Item has been digitized. Prints of image may be requested. Email archives@greatersudbury.ca for more information.
